bioghist.p: John Morin Scott (1789-1858) was a lawyer based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He served as mayor of Philadelphia from 1841 to 1844.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two related volumes. One ledger lists sundries and cash expenditures, 1826-1829. There are payments for a range of items, including house expenses, fuel, the education of Scott's children, and charitable contributions to organizations such as the Guardians of the Poor. The ledger is organized chronologically by month and year. The other ledger groups the expenses by creditor and type and covers 1825-1829. Within each group, listings are chronological and there is a name index to the volume.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
